content: 1 pyramid pods small gift/storage pods decorated with a little loop at the top and toggle closure the pods are super simple to knit all you need to know is how to cast on bind off knit and purl the shape comes from the way they are sewn up with just two easy straight seams skills required working flat seaming yarn gauge dk weight yarn 28 sts and 40 row in 10 x 10 cm 4 x 4 inches in basket rib see main pattern section using yarn shown is sublime extra fine merino dk 3 75mm us 5 needles or size needed to in shades indigo pistachio and natural obtain gauge small 47 metres 51 yards pyramid pod sizes small medium large cast on 43 52 61 sts row 1 ws bind off 15 20 25 sts in knit p to end of row 28 32 36 sts the stitches that have just been bound off produce a little strip which will become the loop at the top of the pod when the piece is made up row 2 & 3 knit next work the basket rib pattern as follows basket rib pattern 4 stitch and 6 row repeat row 1 rs *k2 p2 repeat from * to end of row row 2 ws *k2 p2 repeat from * to end of row row 3-6 knit continue in basket rib until piece measures 20 25 30 cm/8 9 10 inches ending on row 5 purl one row bind off in knit tip for success the aim is to knit a rectangle that is twice as long as it is wide if you do not manage to get exact gauge then measure the width of your piece after you have knitted about 10 cm 4 inches and work the length of your piece to double the measurement of that of the width toggle fastening loop step 1 cast on 15 20 25 sts step 2 bind off all 15 20 25 sts copyright © ellen kapusniak 2014 for
